Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. homered twice, improving to 9-for-14 to start his postseason.
Jackson Merrill and Xander Bogaerts connected on back-to-back home runs for good measure.
Gavin Lux hit a sacrifice fly.
Tommy Edman lined a ball right to Padres first baseman Luis Arraez for an inning-ending double play.
Muncy’s solo home run with two outs in the ninth inning cut the deficit to eight.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The showdown between Clayton Kershaw and Mookie Betts was highly anticipated.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team’s resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Dave Roberts said the first baseman “just couldn’t keep going” after playing the early innings with discomfort.
Max Muncy put bluntly, “We were s—,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freddie Freeman’s ankle became too much, forcing him out of action in the sixth inning.
Freddie Freeman’s status remains uncertain, manager Dave Roberts said Sunday night.
A lineup stirred to life in Game 1 went dormant a night later, floundering in early opportunities against San Diego Padres starter Yu Darvish.
A 10-minute delay after a baseball appeared to be thrown in Profar’s direction and trash thrown at Tatis.
The Dodgers’ pitching was always going to be an issue.
The next, more glaring issue: Will this Dodgers club slug enough to dig out of it?
